1.content: Would you like to pick a sitcom to use?
1.title: Let Us Begin.

152.content: Maybe we should select when in the It Ain't Half Hot Mum series this happens.
152.title: Choose your Place

153.content: There's a number of options as to what leads to this crossover. You must choose.
153.title: Setting?

155.content: Here's a couple of obscure classics.
155.title: And There's...

choices: The other two vehicles pull up behind them.
Only the Rolls Royce reached this point.
1551.content:
Poppy was so crushed by Dicky Metcalfe's betrayal that she never looked outside of the Rolls on the way home. Everyone around her didn't feel all that cheery either. Constable Wilson requested someone to drive the stolen Roster back to the police station since he himself didn't have a license.

Everything was running reasonably well. They were traveling in a convoy style; Lord Meldrum drove the Rolls Royce, followed by the Roster with Teddy in the driver's seat, the motorbike and sidecar being driven by Stokes and, finally, the grocery van. However as they rolled along back towards London something very bizarre took place.

Out of the blue a multi-coloured haze appeared down the road and engulfed almost everyone. Only the grocery van was untouched, but the driver stopped and stared at the empty road ahead.

"What in God's name?!?" Lord Meldrum shouted as he found that there was nothing he could do with the car at this time.

Eventually the strange mist cleared. As the car now rolled along a dirt track in the middle of a forest Meldrum applied the brakes and struggled to avoid hitting the trees before they came to a stop. Poppy remained sobbing on the backseat while Meldrum, Sir Ralph, Lady Agatha, the Lord Bishop and Cissy stepped out.

"What on Earth was that?" Sir Ralph asked in a bewildered tone.

"No idea." Meldrum replied. "Charles?"

"I can't be sure." The bishop replied. "This could be the work of our Lord, but it might be the Devil's work. Only time will tell."
1551.title: Ponyville, Or Bust

15512.content:
"And what do you suggest we do in the meantime? Hm?" Sir Ralph asked in response to this.

"Well, we could always pray?" Charles answered, kneeling down in encouragement of this practice.

"There appears to be a pathway of some kind." Cissy pointed out. "Perhaps we should see where it leads, daddy? It's gotta be better than just standing around waiting to see what's hiding in the forest." Meldrum did look rather uneasy.

"You may have a point there." He acknowledged. "Everyone, back in the car. Let's see if we can find some civilisation." Once again they got back into the Rolls Royce and prepared to start off.

---

Meanwhile the Roster had ended up in the middle of an orchard. Teddy managed to brake soon enough to avoid an accident but still bumped a tree, causing a dozen apples to tumble.

"I say, that was a bit sudden." He remarked once everything settled down.

"Oh, Teddy-bear." Madge Cartwright moaned. "Is it the old war-wound again?"

"No, it's the bally trees!" He argued. "They just... popped up out of nowhere."

"I don't know which it is." PC Wilson stated. "Without a proper account I won't be able to make a report."

"If I may, sir." Twelvetrees ventured. "Perhaps I should take a look at the bonnet, in case there are any dents."

"Well, it's not ours at any rate." Teddy replied.

"Go on, Mr Twelvetrees." Wilson encouraged. "If there are any I shall have to provide a clear report on this to the owner." James Twelvetrees stepped out and leaned over the bonnet, concentrating on the gap between the car and the tree.

As for the motorbike and sidecar, that had turned up in...
15512.title: Stuck in the Trees

choices: Try and muscle his way out.
Concede but carefully plan his defence before their leader.
155121.content:
"BLOODY 'ELL!" Stokes cried as he suddenly found himself serving through a multitude of shockingly brightly-coloured ponies who either turned to stare, galloped away in a panic or gave them all a most disapproving glare. Before long the confusion and panic caused him to drive the motorbike right into an alley and so made a most sudden stop, whereupon Ivy clumsily climbed off the pinion and staggered over to a wall, fearing for the condition of her stomach.

"W...Where are we?" Rose gasped as she glanced around, having only just recovered from the shock of Madge Cartwright's jealously misguided dismissal of her services.

"Well, it ain't Piccadilly Circus." Stokes remarked. "Ah haven't seen anything like this since my daughter was at school." He spared a knowing glance at Ivy. She took a deep breath and staggered with a bit more control back towards him.

"Mr Stokes," She spat, "I don't know what I'm gonna do with yer if yer can't steer a motorcycle."

"Don't 'ave a go at me!" He complained. "Ah di'n't ask all them childish horses to pop outa nowhere." There was a grumpy cough from behind, causing them to turn nervously to see three intimidating stallions in golden armour standing at the entrance to the alley.

"You have intruded into the royal city without warning." One growled in a strong military tone. "You are to come with us for judgment before the Princess."

"Oh 'eck!" Ivy cried. "You've really landed us in it now, d... Mr Stokes."

"Oh, relax Ivy." He answered. "Leave it with me. I'm sure we can explain this." His method was to...
155121.title: Big Blunder

1551212.content:
"We'll jus' go along with'is for now." Stokes whispered to Ivy before stepping towards the guards and announcing. "Sorry to 'ave caused such a ruckus, officer. If you'll jus' direct us to the correct office we'll fill out a form explaining our actions." The guards continued to frown as their senior replied.

"All three of you shall follow us. According to the laws of Equestria you'll have to be detained prior to the Princess's judgment." With that two of the guards flew up and behind the maids while the senior remained glaring at Stokes.

"If that's how it's gonna be, then..." Stokes didn't finish as Ivy and Rose were escorted up to his side before they formed a triangle around them and led them off.

Ivy stared all around her at the size, quality and cleanliness of Canterlot's buildings and streets. Everywhere she looked there were brilliantly coloured ponies going about their business as readily as people would, some would spare a glance or a full-on stare at the aliens but carried on with perhaps the odd remark when it was confirmed they were under escort by the royal guard. Rose, on the other hand, kept looking at the ground in a forlorn manner, occasionally being nudged by a shoulder to ensure she kept up with the group. Stokes was too busy thinking over what to say and/or do to get out of this pickle to notice much of the surroundings but he didn't think too kindly of what he did notice as it reminded him of the old elitist ways of Britain, especially in view of his burning envy and greed

After about fifteen minutes they were led through a rather unassuming gateway into the palace grounds; everything around her made Ivy gawk and gasp in awe and wonder, though the path they were on was rather mediocre compared to the general standards of the palace. Before long a set of steps came up and they were guided down them to a dull functionally-designed door, which opened after a guard gave it a series of taps with his hoof. Once it opened they were taken inside, where a unicorn guard was instructed to assist in escorting them, and led down a dark dimly-lit corridor.

Little was special about this stretch of the journey, apart from a few patches of dampness here and there, but it wasn't long before they came into a more brightly lit and drier space. Unfortunately it put all three of them in mind of the Tower of London in all the worst ways save for the absence of any kind of torture device.

"Put the fat one in D-3." The senior guard commanded, whereupon a strange tingling surrounded Stokes' wrists and seemed to pull him gently but firmly towards the open door of a particular cell.

"Oh, please sir." Ivy spoke up. "Don't be too hard on him; d... Mr Stokes didn't expect to be driving through this place, none of us did."

"Miss," He answered sternly, "I have no information as to your species and you arrived out of nowhere, therefore I have to take precautions regarding national security. However, in keeping with current political philosophy, your detention here will be mitigated compared to that of the criminal sorts. Anyway, you'll be in C-5 and," He turned to one of the other guards, "Put the other female in C-9." With that he firmly nudged Ivy in the appropriate direction with his wing.
1551212.title: Not a Proper Dungeon

choices: Switch to one of the others.
15512122.content:
When the door clinked shut behind her, Ivy looked around and found that the bedding was more up-to-date than the general impression of the cell block and there was a small alcove containing some reasonable semblance of a lavatory. The first thing she did was kneel beside the bed and look up through the grating to the outside, bright sunshine illuminating fine greenery.

"It's me, Ivy." She began. "I know I don't usually get on to you at this time but it's an emergency. Please let these horses or ponies or whatever they are be merciful. I don't know what happened but I'm sure you do. We really didn't mean any harm; at least I haven't, but I can't really speak for my dad's intentions." With that she stood up and, after a few seconds, sat upon the bed.

Rose, meanwhile, was really beginning to tear up over what had happened. She kept trying to explain things to the guard outside but her blubbering made her incoherent; however this did mean that he began to gain a sense of sympathy for her though his training made sure it wouldn't show.

It would be a while before either of the Princesses would request their presence, so shall we return to one of the other groups or stick with the current situation in Canterlot?
15512122.title: In a Cell

choices: In a language he couldn't understand
155121222.content:
Alf Stokes sat on the bed in his cell, half-moping while his mind whirred in an attempt to figure how he could bluff his way out of this. He had a look through his pockets before it dawned on him that they hadn't been searched, causing him to grin. He went up to the cell door and muttered to the guard outside.

"I say, I'd guess you don't get much time-off in yer job, so if you'd be willing to accept a small donation for the charity of yer choice." He proffered six shillings through the bars, which earned a brief glance from the guard before he returned to his original position, expression unchanged. "Well, I guess yer don't 'ave the same currency we do, but they're half-silver. Come on, surely you must understand detainment without trial's immoral." No response. "Alright, maybe this watch'll be accepted by your unit. I'm sure there's an officer who's gonna retire soon, so it'll save all o'yer some money if you were t'accept this gift." Still no response. After a minute of standing there, holding six shillings and a pocket watch through the bars Stokes gave up and returned to the bunk. "No sense o'business." He muttered.

After about an hour he heard the door being unlocked and looked up as a unicorn guard stood on the threshold with an A4-sized card floating in the air beside him.

"The Princess has agreed to seeing you this afternoon." He announced sternly. "Therefore it's been decided that you'll be provided with lunch down here. As we have no information as to your species' dietary requirements you'll have to choose from this simple selection, which spells out exactly what each option contains." The card now sailed over and was suspended in front of Alf's face. After a few seconds of bewilderment he hesitantly reached up and just caught it as it suddenly succumbed to gravity. As it turned out, the menu was written...
155121222.title: A Lunch Offer

info.brief_description: A slightly different take on Human in Equestria crossover stories. MLP:FiM meets Britcoms.
info.description:
We are the bronies. Resistance is Futile. Prepare to be assimilated into the herd. XD

But seriously. This is an interactive for people to take their favourite British sitcom characters and send them to Equestria where personal interaction and cultural exchange can be experimented with. I'll just lay down a few story rules.

Rule 1: No reference to A Canterlot Wedding or The Crystal Empire.
Rule 2: The episodes Dragon Quest and Magic Duel should be considered high risk, so references to them must be minor.
Rule 3: No referencing A Canterlot Wedding.
Rule 4: No one should be written out of character without suitable grounds.
Rule 5: No changelings!
Rule 6: Each storyline must be considered as having a rating equivalent to that of the sitcom's canon.
Rule 7: No changelings!
Rule 8: I don't want to catch anyone saying the Princesses aren't immortal.

Apologies if some of these go against the grain for any of you. However within these parameters anything else's acceptable.
info.pretty_title: My Little Sitcom: Magic is Comedy
